item.title: How to Propagate Pothos / Money Plant / Devil’s Ivy
item.dc:creator: Neil Mahaseth
item.description:
Hi friends in this video I will show you how I propagate Pothos from layering. We will discuss the benefits of propagating by layering vs cutting water propagation. As always...

The post How to Propagate Pothos / Money Plant / Devil’s Ivy appeared first on Plants My Love.
item.content:encoded:
Hi friends in this video I will show you how I propagate Pothos from layering. We will discuss the benefits of propagating by layering vs cutting water propagation. As always I will share with you step-by-step details. Pothos or Money Plant is very easy to propagate. It can grow roots by simply placing them in water. But in this article, I will show you how to propagate Money Plant using layering.

▼Scan @ Video Index▼

  • 00:00 Intro
  • 0:13 Money Plant from Cutting Water Propagation
  • 0:26 Pothos Propagated Using Different Method
  • 1:00 Benefits of Propagating Devils Ivy Layering vs Cutting
  • 1:57 How to Propagate Money Plant Using Layering
  • 2:11 Find a Long Pothos Vine
  • 2:34 Use an Inert Growing Medium Perlite
  • 2:43 Benefits of Using Perlite Growing Medium
  • 3:33 Keep 2-3 Nodes Inside the Growing Medium
  • 4:07 Choose How Long The New Money Plant You Need
  • 4:35 Prepare Money Plant Vine for Layering
  • 4:58 Use a Stone to Anchor it in Place
  • 5:18 Bury The Vine In the Growing Medium
  • 5:31 Keep the Pot Moist
  • 5:57 Subscribe to Watch the Growth Update

Money Plant from Cutting Water Propagation

This is my money plant which I propagated using the normal water cutting propagation. This is around a 2-month-old plant. But compared to the money plant which I propagated using layering just a month ago this is very small. Even the root system is tiny.

Pothos Propagated Using Layering

This is a month-old Pothos plant that developed this vigorous root system in just 20 days in the rooting medium. You can see how huge this is compared to the one which was propagated using water cutting.

Benefits of Propagating Devils Ivy Layering vs Cutting

There are several benefits of cloning Money Plant using layering

  • The rooting time is less compared to cutting propagation.
  • You can get a large plant cloned.
  • It can be done in a climate that is not suitable for cutting propagation like hot and dry weather.

How to Propagate Money Plant Using Layering

So now let’s look step by step at how you can get your Devil’s Ivy cloned using layering.

1. Find a Long Pothos Vine

This is my Pothos plant the first step is to find a long vine that you can easily bend and place inside a pot. I will use the same vine using which I had propagated using layering previously.

2. Use an Inert Growing Medium Perlite

The second step is to prepare the rooting medium. You need to use an inert growing medium like perlite. This prevents any fungal and bacterial issues while rooting the plant. Apart from that perlite also has an excellent water-to-air ratio. Which allows the root enough oxygen while keeping it moist at the same time. Also, it is impossible to overwater perlite if the drainage of the container is proper. Perlite being very light does not hinder root growth.

3. Keep 2-3 Nodes Inside the Growing Medium

Now you need to make sure that the vine which you will be layering should have at least 2-3 Nodes buried in perlite. The node region on the stem is where the leaves emerge. Root growth also happens in this region. So by placing 2-3 nodes in the rooting medium you are doubling or tripling the chance of root development.

4. Choose How Long The New Money Plant You Need

Now decide on the length of your newly cloned money plant will be. The stem that will be coming out from the planter will be your new plant.

5. Prepare Money Plant Vine for Layering

Using a pair of scissors cut the leaves from the part of the stem which will be buried inside the perlite. After that bend the stem inside the pot so that it is placed in the middle.

Use a Stone to Anchor it in Place

The stone anchors the vine and makes sure that it does not come out of the planter. The stone apart from providing support to the vine. Also, ensure the node region is in good contact with the perlite.

Bury The Vine In the Growing Medium

Now add the remaining perlite to cover the entire vine. Make sure all the node region is well inside the perlite.

Keep the Pot Moist

The last thing you need to do is make sure that the perlite does not dry out. Since I have a drip irrigation system installed in my garden I will add a dripper to this planter. You can simply water it daily. As we have used perlite there will be no problem with overwatering.

I hope friends you liked this detailed guide on propagating Money Plant using layering. Hopefully using this guide you will multiply your Pothos plant by several times. I will be posting a plant growth after 15 -20 days so make sure to subscribe to our youtube channel to get notified as soon as we release the video. Thanks for watching friends see you later bye.

The post How to Propagate Pothos / Money Plant / Devil’s Ivy appeared first on Plants My Love.

item.title: How to Propagate Chili Pepper by Air Layering
item.dc:creator: Neil Mahaseth
item.description:
Hi friends in this video we will learn how to clone your chili pepper plant using air layering. Air layering is a vegetative propagation method similar to cutting. But unlike...

The post How to Propagate Chili Pepper by Air Layering appeared first on Plants My Love.
item.content:encoded:
Hi friends in this video we will learn how to clone your chili pepper plant using air layering. Air layering is a vegetative propagation method similar to cutting. But unlike growing by cutting the plant is separate from the mother plant after root development. There is also the benefit that you do not need to care about the weather condition for it to start rooting. As the plant will get an ample supply of nutrients and water from the mother plant while it develops its own root system.

▼Scan @ Video Index▼

  • 00:00 Intro
  • 1:35 Things Required
  • 2:16 Prepare Branch for Air Layering
  • 3:07 Prepare Plastic Bag
  • 4:42 Fill Plastic Bag with Growing Medium
  • 5:47 Seal PlasticBag using Thread
  • 6:38 Repeat the Steps

1. Things Required

You will need the following things:-

  • An Inert Growing Medium like Perlite, Coco Peat, Peat Moss.
  • Rooting Hormone (Optional)
  • String
  • Plastic Sheet
  • Stapler
  • Scissor

2. Prepare Branch for Air Layering

To prepare the stem find a node region from where a new branch is coming out. Cut the leaves and branches near the node region. This will create the space for adding the plastic bag. Now apply the rooting hormone all around the node region you can do this using a brush also.

3. Prepare Plastic Bag

Cut a sheet of plastic that is long enough to cover the node region. The width of this plastic sheet should be good enough to carry the rooting medium. Now place this plastic sheet on the prepared branch. Using staples fold it in the shape of a cylinder to cover the complete branch node region. Using a string seal the bottom end of this cylinder.

4. Fill Plastic Bag with Growing Medium

Make sure the medium is moist and then fill it up in the created plastic bag. I have used a small spoon so that it is easier to fill. Tap the medium so that there is no air gap in the node region.

5. Seal Plastic Bag using Thread

Once completely filled seal the plastic packet from the top using a string. This will ensure that the perlite will remain moist consistently. And that’s it now you just have to wait for a month. After one month you should see the root development. As we have used transparent plastic it will be easier for us to know when the root has developed well enough to sustain the cutting.

I hope friends, you liked this step-by-step guide on propagating chili pepper plants using air layering. Hope using this guide you will be able to easily clone and multiply your chili plants in your garden. Don’t forget to share this video with your friends and family. If you liked this, you might also like our other gardening-related content. I will be posting the chili layering growth update after a month so make sure to subscribe to our youtube channel to get notified as soon as we release the video. Thanks for watching friends see you later bye.

The post How to Propagate Chili Pepper by Air Layering appeared first on Plants My Love.

item.title: How to Grow Railway Creeper from Layering

Hi friends in this video I will show you how I grew Railway Creeper (Morning Glory Species) from layering. This video contains growth updates for 1 year. This is a...

The post How to Grow Railway Creeper from Layering appeared first on Plants My Love.
item.content:encoded:
Hi friends in this video I will show you how I grew Railway Creeper (Morning Glory Species) from layering. This video contains growth updates for 1 year. This is a step-by-step tutorial using which you can propagate any plant from the layering method.

▼Scan @ Video Index▼

  • 00:00 Intro
  • 00:36 Purslane Plant Information
  • 2:26 Type and Length of Railway Creeper vine Layering
  • 3:00 Growing Container and Layering Placement
  • 3:38 Sunlight, Temperature, Soil and Time Required
  • 5:07 Layering Update after 2 Months
  • 5:46 Layering Separation and Transplant in Ground
  • 8:18 Railway Creeper Growth after 5 Months
  • 8:46 Railway Creeper Growth after 1 Year

I hope friends, you liked this video guide on How to Grow Railway Creeper from Layering. If yes, don’t forget to share this video with your friends and family whom you think could benefit from it. If you liked this, you might also like our other gardening-related content. Make sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel or join our mailing list to be alerted as soon as a new video is released. Thanks for watching friends see you later bye.

The post How to Grow Railway Creeper from Layering appeared first on Plants My Love.
